title: Creative visualization (design)
text: In <a href="design">design</a>, Creative Visualization refers to the process by which <a href="Computer-generated%20imagery">computer generated imagery</a>, <a href="Computer%20animation">digital animation</a>, <a href="Architectural%20model">three-dimensional models</a>, and two-dimensional representations, such as <a href="Architecture">architectural blueprints</a>, <a href="engineering%20drawings">engineering drawings</a>, and <a href="Sewing">sewing patterns</a> are created and used in order to visualize a potential product prior to production. Such products include prototypes for vehicles in <a href="Automotive%20engineering">automotive</a> <a href="engineering">engineering</a>, <a href="apparel">apparel</a> in the <a href="Fashion%23Fashion%20industry">fashion industry</a>, and <a href="building">building</a>s in <a href="Architecture">architectural</a> <a href="design">design</a>.
